intro: Luzula confusa f. latifolia, commonly known as the broad-leaved woodrush, is a variant of the woodrush plant native to temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. It is a perennial herbaceous plant characterized by its dense, grass-like foliage and cylindrical, spike-like inflorescences. The leaves are typically broad and flat, distinguishing it from other Luzula species. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. The plant produces small, greenish flowers that are clustered in spikes, contributing to its ecological role in forest ecosystems.
